```{r setup, include=TRUE, message=FALSE} 
library(hexSticker)

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

You can make awesome hex stickers for your R packages using [hexSticker](https://github.com/GuangchuangYu/hexSticker). 

# phenomix


```{r}   
img1 <- here::here("images/echolocatoR_logo.png")
# img2 <- "../images/phoenix_pixel.png"

stick <- hexSticker::sticker(
        subplot = img1, 
        url = tolower("https://github.com/RajLabMSSM/echolocatoR"), u_color = "#56ffff", u_size = 3.5,
        #### Package name ####
        package="echoverse",p_color = "white",p_size=10, p_y = .5, 
        #### Subplot #####
        s_x=1, s_y=1,  s_width = .9,
        #### Fill & border ####
        h_fill = "#25355c", h_color = "#41c6c8", 
        #### Spotlight ####
        spotlight = TRUE, l_alpha = .3, l_width = 10,  
        #### File output ####
        filename= here::here("inst/hex/hex.png"), dpi = 300)

```
